sections: Corporate executive pay skyrocketed in 2020 during the pandemic while workers, hailed as heroes, saw their wages stagnate. New data from the Economic Policy Institute found that CEOs saw their compensation jump by 16 percent during the pandemic while average worker pay increased at a rate that just beat inflation.

Also, survival checks had huge, albeit temporary, effects on people’s lives, and while Joe Biden has made new moves to stem Arctic drilling, his heart might not really be in it. Learn more in today’s Midday Poster below, exclusively for subscribers!

to strip workers of their federal unemployment benefits and force them back into unsafe, low-wage jobs.
Survival checks substantially improved American life according to a

of U.S. Census data. After the $600 and $1,400 checks went out, there was a 42 percent decline in the number of households with children experiencing food shortages from January to April, a 43 percent decline in financial instability, and a more than 20 percent decline in anxiety and depression. However, these improvements were only temporary, because the checks were one-time payments.
